p: Temporal stability was also negatively related to long‐term provisioning for indicators of C cycling. Total ecosystem carbon stock (Fig. 3e) showed a strong negative relationship between ES provisioning and stability ( P < 0.001, R 2 = 0.674), with a 5% increase in C stocks resulting in a 17.9% reduction in temporal stability. For C uptake, on the other hand, the relationship between temporal stability and ES provisioning was weak and not statistically significant ( P = 0.367, R 2 = 0.002).
